sub_title: Senior Director: Church Partnerships at World Vision
summary: Proven visionary leader with extensive experience in building church and faith partnerships for development outcomes, thought leadership and strategic direction, program development and global scale-up, catalyzing change, global representation of organisation, and relationship building leading to increased shared outcomes. Demonstrated leadership in the face of adversity coupled with passionate staff management which inspires. Notable achievements include creating a transformational evidence based project model to catalyse change, lead global scale-up mobilising 455,000 faith leaders across 48 countries to engage in the most challenging development issues.

treasury_media.title: PaRD's Vision
treasury_media.description: PaRD brings together governmental and intergovernmental entities with diverse civil society organisations (CSOs) and faith-based organisations (FBOs), to engage the social capital and capacities vested in diverse faith communities for sustainable development and humanitarian assistance in the spirit of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

treasury_media.title: World Vision's Faith and Development work
treasury_media.description: World Vision's commitment is to meet the needs of the most vulnerable around the globe, especially children. Its strategic focus as an organisation includes helping provide children with good health, education, love, protection and a place for children's voices to be heard.

school.name: Medical University of Southern Africa (MEDUNSA) now University of North West

education.degree_name: Master of Public Health (MPH) Cum Laude

profile_positions.description: Deepen and build collaboration with churches, Christian networks and other faith actors towards increased child well-being in all the countries where World Vision operates.
profile_positions.title: Senior Director: Church Partnerships

profile_positions.description:
Lead the prioritization of external engagements and representation of World Vision for its contribution in faith and development; and strengthen our collaborative impact through smart partnerships with Churches, faith based organisations/networks; and secular agencies.  Build staff capacity across WV partnership to leverage partnerships in all areas of WV’s work with local faith communities, and global faith-based organisations; implement evidence-based programming catalyzing the strengths of faith actors to deliver toward increased child-wellbeing and the sustainable development goals; influence policy through collaborative advocacy resulting in increased influence and investment through the utilization of evidence of WV’s work with faith actors.

Co-Chair of the board of the Joint Learning Initiative and local faith communities; Member of UN Faith Advisory Council for Religion and Development.
profile_positions.title: Senior Director: Faith  and External Engagements

profile_positions.description:
Provide strategic direction, thought leadership and technical expertise on the development, quality implementation and scale-up of faith-centered programming to address some of the most complex development issues.  Developed and lead the scale-up of the 5 Channels of Hope (CoH) curricula on HIV, MNCH, Ebola, Gender and Child Protection.  Build evidence base on the impact of CoH in collaboration with credible academic partners, and utilize the results externally and internally to increased influence in the field of faith and development.

Impact: Channels of Hope reached 455,873 faith leaders through 21,744 workshops in 47 countries offering skills, attitudes and connections to respond to child protection, HIV, health and gender challenges in their communities (2005-2017).
profile_positions.title: Director Faith partnerships for Development

profile_positions.description: Provide strategic leadership and technical support for program implementation and partnership building regarding HIV and infectious diseases to all countries in the WV partnership.
profile_positions.title: Director: HIV and Infectious diseases

profile_positions.description: Responsible for global scale-up of HIV programmes to catalyse local church and faith actors towards an appropriate faith inspired and evidence-based HIV response. Lead the development of a strategic plan for scale-up and adaptation of Channels of Hope to fit various religious, denominational, cultural, language and regional contexts.
profile_positions.title: Global Advisor HIV and Faith partnerships

profile_positions.location: Africa Regional Office, Johannesburg, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
Lead the development of a strategic plan to equip WV staff in Africa to engage with local faith leaders and faith communities and global FBOs to address HIV through programmatic interventions which will break down stigma, encourage comprehensive prevention and compassionate care to all people without judgement. This included the formation of an appropriate project model, capacity building, mentoring and scale-up across the African countries with a high HIV prevalence in which WV works. 
Co-founder of the African Network of Religious Leaders Infected or Affected by HIV and AIDS (ANERELA+); served as vice-chair of the ANERELA+ board
profile_positions.title: African Advisor on HIV and AIDS and Church/FBO Partnerships

profile_positions.description: Develop and implement programmatic approaches which combined the core elements of WV’s Hope Initiative of HIV prevention, care and advocacy with a core focus on mobilizing church leaders in all operational areas of South Africa and Lesotho
profile_positions.title: HIV and AIDS Coordinator for South Africa and Lesotho

profile_positions.description:
Develop and scale-up the "I have Hope" HIV program, one of South Africa’s first country-wide community HIV and sexuality education and sensitising programme with primary target high school youth aged 13-18, and secondary any other community audiences in South Africa, including students, churches, women’s groups, etc.

Impact: The I have Hope program reached approximately 250,000 high school pupils.  The evaluation of the HIV peer education program, demonstrated significant changes in HIV related stigma, knowledge and attitude. 
	Designed and conducted quasi-experimental research study to demonstrate the impact of the “I have Hope” peer group model on the peer leaders involved.  This study formed the basis of the MPH thesis.
	Initiator and presenter of “Stories vol Hoop” (Stories of Hope), a fortnightly live radio programme on HIV and AIDS, giving a face to HIV+ people and organizations making a difference in the AIDS field. This program ran uninterrupted on South African national radio (RSG) for 3 years (1999-2002).
	Writer and Presenter of Love Life television programme – a series of 13 programmes on teenage sexuality and HIV and AIDS.  The program was broadcasted and repeated on all national television channels. (1993)
	Developed and implemented a holistic interfaith HIV and AIDS mobilizing programme for the National Religious Association for Social Development (NRASD) funded by SA ministry of Social Development.
	Lead or co-lead the setup of two community based HIV organisations:
o	Christian AIDS Bureau of Southern Africa (CABSA)
o	Stellenbosch AIDS Action Group
	Developed and co-facilitated an HIV and AIDS community mobilization project for most at risk community in Stellenbosch.  This project is funded by Bristol-Myers Squibb’s Secure the Future Foundation.
profile_positions.title: Program lead: "I have Hope" HIV&AIDS community awareness
